Email Conversation Export
=========================
Export Date: 2025-09-26 13:32:52
Folder: C1HZCXB - 2025 mid-year check-in take time to reflect and realign
Message Count: 3

--------------------------------------------------
ID: C1HZCXB_00
From: Performance Management <performance.management@chalhoub.com>
To: 
CC: Sujay Dsilva <Sujay.Dsilva@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-06-02 12:50
Subject: 2025 Mid-Year Check-In: Take Time to Reflect and Realign
--------------------------------------------------
Dear All,

Hope you’re doing well.

As we step into the second half of the year, now is the perfect time to pause, reflect, and reconnect on your goals. Your Mid-Year Check-In—scheduled between June 1 and August 31—is an opportunity to:

*	Reflect on progress made so far
*	Identify any support you may need
*	Realign your goals with evolving team and business priorities

These conversations aren’t just a formality—they’re a powerful tool to stay focused, motivated, and connected. In fact, we’ve seen that employees who engage in a meaningful mid-year check-in often experience stronger alignment and better outcomes at year-end reviews.

✅ Book your check-in with your manager today!

If any changes or updates are agreed during your conversation, log into DRIVE to revise your goals. The system is now open for goal amendments and will remain open until August 31.

Here is how you access your goals on DRIVE.

metadata.doc_id: C1HZCXB - 2025 mid-year check-in take time to reflect and realign\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\C1HZCXB - 2025 mid-year check-in take time to reflect and realign\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
If any changes or updates are agreed during your conversation, log into DRIVE to revise your goals. The system is now open for goal amendments and will remain open until August 31.

Here is how you access your goals on DRIVE.

 

*	Go to the 2025 Goal Plan. <https://performancemanager5.successfactors.eu/sf/goals?bplte_company=Chalhoub> 
*	Use the available tools to track progress, edit completion percentages, and create related activities
*	Document your mid-year conversations under the Continuous Performance section <https://performancemanager5.successfactors.eu/xi/ui/talentuxr/pages/index.xhtml?bplte_company=Chalhoub&_s.crb=PgODz3vvOKPhV10pLfXxJzRlvZGNKcUAAJQr2njsjLk%253d#/activityList> —this becomes a great reference for future reviews
*	Request feedback using the Continuous Feedback <https://performancemanager5.successfactors.eu/sf/uxrFeedback?bplte_company=Chalhoub&_s.crb=PgODz3vvOKPhV10pLfXxJzRlvZGNKcUAAJQr2njsjLk%253d>   feature—from peers, direct reports, or colleagues you’ve worked closely with

 

Resources to help you get started:

chunks.text:
Resources to help you get started:

*	Performance Page <https://onechalhoub.connexionsnow.com/content/my-performance-page-1>  on One Chalhoub (including FAQs)
*	Goal Setting & Cascading Guide <https://onechalhoub.connexionsnow.com/resources/file/NDIw>  
*	Systems Guide <https://onechalhoub.connexionsnow.com/resources/file/MTkz>  on Setting Goals in DRIVE
*	‘ Goal Setting & Owning Your Performance <https://mctfze.sharepoint.com/:p:/s/TMPM_WorkingSpace/ESvm614EMkFEmmWt1vcu5hgBIwE0wvPICXHePT2Kct7LVQ?e=4LNPtS> ’ Roadshow Presentation
*	Echo <https://apps.powerapps.com/play/e/default-6ef8304c-f37b-42a5-a569-0a7d8249fbf3/a/bf9ec4d8-d011-4eae-a1f0-a72c8cdac335?tenantId=6ef8304c-f37b-42a5-a569-0a7d8249fbf3&hint=a506f883-8ed7-4625-bcec-45910cc03711&sourcetime=1737527244769>  Chatbot &  Demo Video <https://mctfze-my.sharepoint.com/:v:/g/personal/nasir_tijani_chalhoub_com/EXvNl8HjUTNNoDFJ28iJeUUBJxohIPKUtRJ16eGL74bnGw?e=Rjfpn5&isSPOFile=1>  for SMART Goal Setting assistance

 

Let’s take this opportunity to recalibrate and set ourselves up for a strong finish to 2025—with clarity, alignment, and a shared sense of purpose.

 

If you need support or have questions about the process, please don’t hesitate to reach out to Sujay Dsilva - Performance Management Team or your respective People Partner.

 

Best Regards,

Performance Management Team

Dear All,

Hope you’re doing well and planning to go on your well-deserved break!

As we step into the second half of the year, now is the perfect time to pause, reflect, and reconnect on your goals. Your Mid-Year Check-In—scheduled between June 1 and August 31—is an opportunity to:

*	Reflect on progress made so far
*	Identify any support you may need
*	Realign your goals with evolving team and business priorities

These conversations aren’t just a formality—they’re a powerful tool to stay focused, motivated, and connected. In fact, we’ve seen that employees who engage in a meaningful mid-year check-in often experience stronger alignment and better outcomes at year-end reviews.

✅ Book your check-in with your manager today!

If any changes or updates are agreed during your conversation, log into DRIVE to revise your goals. The system is now open for goal amendments and will remain open until August 31.

Here is how you access your goals on DRIVE.

ID: C1HZCXB_02
From: Sabitha Menon <Sabitha.Menon@chalhoub.com>
To: 
CC: 
BCC: 
Date: 2025-08-20 13:17
Subject: Re: 2025 Mid-Year Check-In: Take Time to Reflect and Realign
--------------------------------------------------
Dear All,
Hope you all had a well deserved summer break!
This is a gentle reminder to complete your Mid-Year Check-In with your manager before August 31.
As mentioned in my earlier, this is a valuable opportunity to:

*	
	Reflect on your progress so far
*	
	Identify any support you may need
*	
	Realign your goals with evolving team and business priorities

✅ Please make sure to schedule your conversation if you haven’t already. After your check-in, remember to update your goals and document the discussion in DRIVE under the Continuous Performance section.
You can find all supporting resources on the Performance Page <https://onechalhoub.connexionsnow.com/content/my-performance-page-1>  on One Chalhoub, including FAQs, guides, and system demos.
Let’s take this chance to stay aligned and set ourselves up for a strong finish to 2025.
Thank you for your attention, and please feel free to reach out if you need any support.
Kind regards,
